Articles.Content:
Are we gonna get more consistent part variety? Here are a few examples:

There is no shorter version of SM hydrogen tank

Missing SM cargo nose cone

Ideally, they should've opted for procedural length here, but since that isn't the case...
i just hope we get procedural tanks at some point, that would really help with part count and rocket stability/wobble

I think the lack of a shorter hydrogen tank is an intentional design choice to force you to go big for nuclear engines (which I think is a fair one), though we could go with a small nose cone fairing yeah. 

One thing I wish for is for more of the flat plate adapters for large and xl sizes, I love the flatness of the plate adapters (A large to small adapter would be lovely)

1 minute ago, Strawberry said:

One thing I wish for is for more of the flat plate adapters for large and xl sizes

I wanted to include that as well, but I forgot.

2 minutes ago, Strawberry said:

lack of a shorter hydrogen tank is an intentional design choice

I like to mount fuel tanks radially sometimes. I guess everybody does. You can see how that may be a problem here

4 minutes ago, cocoscacao said:

I like to mount fuel tanks radially sometimes. I guess everybody does. You can see how that may be a problem here 

I think doughnut style hydrogen tanks would be cool

The cargo bays would benefit from tube-style length options, but if that's not the option for whatever reason, a middle length would be nice. Short one is too short for most use cases, and long one is too long, I don't like carrying air.

@The Aziz Many parts would benefit from it. Just setting action group button to open close multiple cargo bays is tedious. I'm not promoting full procedural (like engine mount length), but at least modular. You can set length from 1 to 4, where 1 is the length of a SM version. That implementation shouldn't be hard given what is already made.
I don't get why they did proc wings but not proc tanks.  Seems... schizophrenic.  Especially with this game having more fuel types.
